pullRequest.title: DDF-6124 deprecated ClientFactoryFactory and transitioned to a builder pattern instead
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR do?
Who is reviewing it?
@SmithJosh @bakejeyner
Select relevant component teams:
@codice/security
Ask 2 committers to review/merge the PR and tag them here.
@blen-desta
@garrettfreibott
@pklinef
@stustison
How should this be tested?

Any background context you want to provide?
What are the relevant tickets?
Fixes: #____
Screenshots

Checklist:

 Documentation Updated
 Update / Add Threat Dragon models
 Update / Add Unit Tests
 Update / Add Integration Tests

Notes on Review Process
Please see Notes on Review Process for further guidance on requirements for merging and abbreviated reviews.
Review Comment Legend:

✏️ (Pencil) This comment is a nitpick or style suggestion, no action required for approval. This comment should provide a suggestion either as an in line code snippet or a gist.
❓ (Question Mark) This comment is to gain a clearer understanding of design or code choices, clarification is required but action may not be necessary for approval.
❗ (Exclamation Mark) This comment is critical and requires clarification or action before approval.

nodes.bodyText: ❓ What value do we get from this being an interface? It doesn't hide any dependencies, and would need to change whenever the builder adds or removes arguments

❓ Can we make this a completely fluent api? It would be nice if we didn't have to see the builder at all. I'm imagining something like:
ClientFactory clientFactory = clientFactory.builder()
    .prop1()
    .prop2()
    .build()

I would love to see this API combine some of these parameters such that they're not all top-level. For example:
builder.withBasic("username", "password").build()

or
builder
    .withOAuth()   // Have this return some object that builds oauth configuration
        .clientId("client")
        .clientSecret("secret")
        .oauthFlow("authorization_code")
        .additionalParameters(...)
        .and()    // Return the original builder
    .build()

That would make it much clearer how to use the API to properly conflgure the client

A copy of the GNU Lesser General Public + * License is distributed along with this program and can be found at + * . + */ +package org.codice.ddf.cxf.client; + +import java.util.List; +import java.util.Map; +import org.apache.cxf.interceptor.Interceptor; +import org.apache.cxf.message.Message; +import org.codice.ddf.configuration.PropertyResolver; + +/** + * Builder class for creating secure CXF client factory objects that can generate WebClients + * + *

This code is experimental. While this interface is functional and tested, it may change or + * be * removed in a future version of the library. + */ +public interface ClientFactoryBuilder { + + SecureCxfClientFactory build(); + + /** + * The endpoint the client should connect to. + * + * @param endpointUrl + * @return + */ + ClientFactoryBuilder endpointUrl(String endpointUrl); + + /** + * The JAX-RS interface class/type that represents the endpoint + * + * @param interfaceClass + * @return + */ + ClientFactoryBuilder interfaceClass(Class interfaceClass); + + ClientFactoryBuilder entityProviders(List entityProviders); + + ClientFactoryBuilder interceptor(Interceptor interceptor); + + /** + * Turns the CN check off when performing a TLS/SSL connection. This is for test only. + * + * @param disableCnCheck + * @return + */ + ClientFactoryBuilder disableCnCheck(boolean disableCnCheck); + + /** + * Whether or not to allow the client to follow redirects. + * + * @param allowRedirects + * @return + */ + ClientFactoryBuilder allowRedirects(boolean allowRedirects); + + /** + * Time before the connection will fail with no reply. + * + * @param connectionTimeout + * @return + */ + ClientFactoryBuilder connectionTimeout(Integer connectionTimeout); + + /** + * Time before connection will fail with no response. + * + * @param receiveTimeout + * @return + */ + ClientFactoryBuilder receiveTimeout(Integer receiveTimeout); + + /** + * Username to use with BASIC authentication. + * + * @param username + * @return + */ + ClientFactoryBuilder username(String username);

nodes.bodyText:
❓ What are your thoughts about changing this method to actually take java.net.URL?  That would make sure the builder is always taking in a valid URL.  You could convert it back to string in ClientBuilderImpl setter or before calling the factory.
This currently feels like we are leaking implementation details that JAXRSClientFactoryBean taking addresses as Strings and Config Admin/system property addresses are also Strings.  The first time we find out the values are incorrect is way down in CXF code.

nodes.bodyText: ✏️ Class in the method name feels redundant with the argument type.  interface(Class<T>) should get the same point across.

nodes.bodyText:
❓ Thoughts on making keystorePath an actual java.nio.file.Path?
It is always nice to use a well typed parameter if one exists instead of a String where possible.

nodes.bodyText:
Too bad there is not an enum in Java for the SSL protocols.
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#SSLContext
